website_summaries.verdict: Open-ended play has never been more fun than with this wooden block set. A solid deal on a toy your child will use for years.
pros: Four bright colors are not only fun but teach kids to learn colors
cons: Lightweight wood eventually gets nicks and scratches

customer_reviews.title: Hazzard
customer_reviews.text: Blocks were not even two weeks old when they started falling apart. Choking and splinter hazzard.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this miniature wannabe set of blocks
customer_reviews.text: I wish the box for these hadn't gotten tossed during the chaos of opening Christmas gifts or I'd return them. I wondered why they were so cheap. If you're thinking these are like the blocks you've seen before like I was you're mistaken. These are so tiny they're useless. Only an adult with great fine motor skills would be able to build what's pictured in the listing. They're too tiny for kids to be that precise. Usually I like Melissa & Doug products. This is a flop.
customer_reviews.author: littlespender

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous for younger children
customer_reviews.text: Block broke while my 2.5 yo was playing with it. Created a potentially dangerous situation.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Broken blocks
customer_reviews.text: As another had noted, the blocks are flawed. It was only my little ones second time playing with the blocks and she took her blocks out and I noticed her go to put something in her mouth. I am glad I was there to grab it.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Extremely small, bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting good quality like the retro version of these blocks. There is nowhere in the description that says that size. They are extremely small and not good for a child under 2. It says that on the box, but it doesn't say that in the description of product. I was going to return, but will cost more in shipping than it is worth. Also, not well made, not solid wood, these are a hazard. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed at the quality
customer_reviews.text: Kinda upset by the quality of these blocks. We have several Melissa and Doug products that are always up to par. These seemed to have been milled wrong, and haven't been checked for defects such as holes. I've included some pictures where they're cracked, have holes in the blocks, or have had their sides shaved down to where it's a weird angled block(not the square it's supposed to be). I'll probably go with traditional wood blocks and dish out a bit more for better quality. Oh well :/
customer_reviews.author: C.B.Chu

customer_reviews.title: NOT the same size as other M&D sets!
customer_reviews.text: These blocks are much smaller than I anticipated. My 4yo and I enjoy building blocks, and we are starting to include the baby, so I thought these fun colors would be good. Unfortunately, nearly half of the blocks are small enough to be choking hazards. It is my fault for not checking the dimensions, I guess. They were only $10 when I bought the set though, so I'm just going to remove the too-small blocks and save them for the future.
customer_reviews.author: BecF

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: The blocks are fine but I was really surprised at how small they were. Definitely way smaller than the old school wooden blocks my own children had when they were little. My grandson likes them, so I guess that's what matters but I felt a bit disappointed with them. They also have too many triangular pieces than needed and much fewer of the structural shapes that are great for building.
customer_reviews.author: Grace1120

customer_reviews.title: These are just OK...
customer_reviews.text: These are just OK. My 3yo daughter enjoys playing with them and making all sorts of things from princess castles, to giant cakes, to beds for her dolls. I’m glad she likes them, but I think I probably could have put the money towards a better set of blocks. These are made of very lightweight wood so they aren’t the best for building vertically. A lot of the blocks have uneven edges or sides that aren’t smooth, resulting in problematic construction. I don’t intend to return them, but if I had the chance to redo this purchase, I would have gone for something else.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made for Melissa and Doug
customer_reviews.text: So I got these for my boys, they are 2 and 3 years old. And honestly I’m disappointed with the quality. They are poorly made. There are blocks with paint chipped off, right out of the package. Also edges are chipped, you can see the wood grain and feel the texture of if. They are not smooth at all. I wouldn’t get these again unless they are having a super sale on them. 2 stars because at the end of the day, they are blocks and they can be used to build things and my boys like to play with them.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Binns - Craven

customer_reviews.title: Quality has changed
customer_reviews.text: I had this product before and I decided to purchase more blocks just because what child won’t want more blocks? I was mildly disappointed that the blocks quality was much less than it was before. The smoothness and finish of it was not as good as it was before. Otherwise, it serves its purpose well and keep my children busy.
customer_reviews.author: Agnes P

customer_reviews.title: Beats screen-time every-time!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these. I wanted to get something that would be a fun activity that was an imagination and brain builder as well. These are great, many different sizes and they fit together well. Some of the cheaper brands aren't milled correctly so they don't truly lay flat when stacked. These were all good - I think I found one that was bad. Out of 100, that's pretty good I'd say. Overall a great toy that is much better than sticking your little one in front of some LED's for hours on end! I swear - the older toys are some of the best ones.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan L.

customer_reviews.title: Not like the blocks
customer_reviews.text: Melissa & Doug have some really great stuff for kids, which is why I was disappointed in these. They're not like the old blocks that most of us grew up with. They're a lighter wood and the block pieces are thinner and smaller. Obviously, they still stack and are colorful, but wish they had the durability of the blocks from the 70's and 80's. I don't think I'd try to drive a nail through these. (come on...you all know you did it, at least once...)
customer_reviews.author: Been There Done That

customer_reviews.title: A great set of building blocks!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed my 3 year old was using legos to build towers and knock them down, but it didn't have the same effect as regular building blocks did since they click together. So I ordered these and she absolutely loves them! She always has fun playing with it and loves putting it away too (no complaints there ha!). There are 100 peices of different shapes and sizes. The colors are beautiful. The pieces are wooden yet light. Perfect for toddler motion sensory development. The box it comes in can be used to store it, and it also has a handle to easily carry it around. Overall this product is fun, smart and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Denielle 🌺

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids are 8 and 2 and they both love building things. It's great for getting them to use their imagination. Although I like them there is some small issues. I give them 3/5 for durability considering a few pieces have already started to have paint chipped off and we've had it less than a month. The pieces are smaller and skinnier than I expected. I would say these are better for 2 and up because I'm not sure they would be sturdy enough for a teething toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Criss Buenrostro

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality but very small
customer_reviews.text: These blocks are cute, well made, durable and brightly painted. I guess I was just very disappointed in how small they are. I don't know if all building blocks are this small now, had I known I would've looked for some that were the same size as when I was a kid and when my son was a kid. These are maybe half or more like a third of that size. All 100 blocks fit in a box that's only 8" long x 6" wide x 6" deep. Maybe it's just me but it seems everything is getting smaller and smaller but never costs any less.
customer_reviews.author: Pam W

customer_reviews.title: A good value, but not an outstanding product overall.
customer_reviews.text: These blocks are pretty nice, but nothing too wonderful. I suppose they are a good deal, for the money. A few thoughts: 1. They are much smaller than I expected. I used to have blocks of similar shapes and colors, but they were much bigger! 2. These blocks are made of a very lightweight wood. I imagine they will get beat up with regular use. 3. This is pretty picky for low-cost blocks, but there are a few knots/irregularities that make it hard to build very tall towers without "cherry picking" the best blocks. Overall, a good value.
customer_reviews.author: mofo83

customer_reviews.title: I recently purchased this for my daughter and while I would play w her and she loved knocking them down
customer_reviews.text: Chocking hazard!!! Please beware. I recently purchased this for my daughter and while I would play w her and she loved knocking them down, today I deciding to let her play w them on her own. She put a smaller piece of the wooden blocks into her mouth and was choking. Thankfully I was near by to remove it. I have since removed all the small wooden blocks. Please beware
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality, shocked! Wonder if it’s counterfeit returned from someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Hao Chen

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Upon purchasing I read other reviews which said the blocks were small and they are- the cube is a standard 1” cube. My daughter is 2 and I was hoping to get her the large wooden blocks but for the price range these will do. None of these pieces were damaged, but there is a strong scent which Is a little disturbing; hope it wears off after a while. All in all not a bad purchase for our first set.
customer_reviews.author: Annajoanna

customer_reviews.title: Don’t pass them up
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter loves building blocks . I don’t think she cares if they are colored or not but it’s a nice touch and definitely helps sharpen motor skills . 100 pieces is a bit much I let her have maybe 30-40 at a time otherwise they will be all over
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Washington

customer_reviews.title: Reordered another package in under 10 minutes... great item
customer_reviews.text: We loved these so much that within 10 minutes of opening them I reordered another set! My 2 year old granddaughter has outgrown her foam blocks - her favorite pastime is building with her 16 year old uncle—- but they both get frustrated because the foam blocks always tip over- and these are ideal. Very well priced compared to other block sets listed on Amazon and they have flat edges and vibrant colors....
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Classic and great
customer_reviews.text: My son was 2 when we got these and he loves them. I don't think there's been a day he hasn't played with them since we got them. He loves sorting the shapes and colors, building towers and trains. The wood itself is super light. Our puppy got ahold of one and one bite had the block split in half. Some of the paint is chipping on the other blocks from normal play.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Vega

customer_reviews.title: Good blocks, taste good too
customer_reviews.text: These were a big hit with all 3 of my kids ages 2, 7, and 9... the blocks are good quality... my dog even likes them so much I dont have any blocks left.. the dog chewed up every block... they do look delicious... so these make a great kid toy and dog snack...
customer_reviews.author: kevin baker

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like the size but still glad we bought it
customer_reviews.text: First gave this 3 stars because of the size, I thought they were bigger. But now more then a year out my kids bith still love and play either this bock set. For the price you can't beat it. I'd recommend first kids echo don't put too much in their moyths, my 18/24 mid liked to put things in his mouth, and the paint will get chewed off, and there are smaller blocks, but once they're a but older its lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: B.R.

customer_reviews.title: Blocks for grandchilren
customer_reviews.text: I bought these blocks for my grandchildren and they have kept them entertained for hours of play. They are durable and well made. Feel confident to add them to your home's collection of toys. They were an excellent choice and the box they came in makes them easy to store for tucking them away. Bravo great product.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Endless imaginative play with quality product.
customer_reviews.text: These are very boldly colored and are just right for a 9-18 month old baby's fist. The popular plastic building blocks, though made for this age, cannot be built by someone under 2; at least none of my 7 children did. They could only take them apart after some frustration and closer to the age of 18 mo to 2 yr. Babies can at least stack a couple of these by age 9-12 months. These are much more fun to knock down. No frustrations with lack of strength or dexterity issues. As they pick up blocks, the parent can call out the colors and shapes. They absorb this knowledge like a sponge before they may be able to speak it.
customer_reviews.author: Dory

customer_reviews.title: Great little addition to toy box.
customer_reviews.text: Doug and Melissa do it again. This block set has vibrant colors, shapes and is definitely easy to clean. I have submerged them in warm mild soapy water, then air dried on dish rack. They are well made and sturdy. My grandchildren ages 18 months to 7 years love playing with them. I know it's a simple toy, but it is educational and provides fun for all.
customer_reviews.author: emb_98

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's just been too long since I've played with blocks. But I was disappointed when they arrived with the size. Too small. Grandkids have no idea, and played with them just the same. Which was Awesome - Because they are ~ Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Lawson

customer_reviews.title: After use, one of the blocks split slightly
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these blocks and play with them often. I love that they provide open ended play and are great for making towers and patterns.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Lysaker

customer_reviews.title: No Complaints!
customer_reviews.text: High quality blocks. The bigger pieces are about the length of an adult index finger. Bright colors, doesn't chip, made of wood. You won't be able to use the box as storage once you unpack it, btw, so just get a shoebox size plastic bin and they fit perfectly. I might buy a second set just so my son can build larger structures.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Box in bad condition
customer_reviews.text: These blocks were a gift. I am very disappointed in the box these blocks came in. The whole box was completely wrapped in clear tape. Every inch was taped. On the side of the box was a big white blank sticker. This sticker was covering up a name and address that I can clearly read. On the other side it says Amazon returns. It appears this is a used item. There is no way I can give this as a gift. It looks like something that was picked up at a yard sale!
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Opened our new blocks today to go with our new shelf and one was broken. Otherwise all look great and should be fun for my toddler. He's almost 17 months, still puts every single thing he touches in his mouth so may have to put some of the smaller pieces away, we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: M. Solberg

customer_reviews.title: Well made, nice gift
customer_reviews.text: I really like these blocks. I bought them for my 3 month old. Some of the blocks are too small due to her age, so I will be giving her just some pieces at the time. I started with some of the cubes. They are small compared to the soft stacking cubes made for babies, but they are still a safe size and she plays with them, stacking and throwing them
customer_reviews.author: Alessandra

customer_reviews.title: Too small pieces for little ones
customer_reviews.text: Some pieces seem smaller than indicated. Wish I had sent them back just for that alone but our granddaughter had opened them by ripping the box. More appropriate for say 3+. Our granddaughter is just 2 and although she doesn’t put things in her mouth these I think might not pass the test of the esophagus tube.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cute block set
customer_reviews.text: Have been watching this. Recently price dropped and I had to grab it. My 1.5 yr old is really getting into stacking things. So she doesn't quite "build" yet. But loves to stack. Would be nice if the box was a little more durable to double as long term storage. Hope she will get enjoyment out of these for quite a few years. If she doesn't lose them all. I love all Melissa and Doug stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bullins

customer_reviews.title: Cracked wood and chipped paint
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely lower quality than most Melissa&Doug products. Several of the wood blocks were cracked and even more had chipped paint. They also had an off gas smell from the paint agyer first opening.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Day disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 2 year old. Some of the block chipped and broke within 24 hours. Concerned about swallowing hazard. Wish I had the box so I could return. My daughter-in-law tossed some out last night. UPDATE: I phoned Melissa & Doug directly and was told new blocks are on the way. Customer friendly and quick to make right.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M. S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not only are these blocks are surprisingly small, it also seems as though they were packaged while the paint was still wet. Many of our blocks came stuck together, we have yet to be able to pry some of them apart, and the ones we have have the paint from others stuck to them. Disappointed because I expected more from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Addie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Education Toy
customer_reviews.text: Love that the box that the blocks came in can also be used to store them! I thought for sure throwing them in unorganized would not give enough space to hold them after initially taking them out. These blocks are just how they are pictured and kept my daughter entertained!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: The blocks are smaller than I expected. Kids likes them but still a little young for the small size of the blocks. I did notice that chemical smell other talk about but it does go away. The box fell apart immediately so we have them in a bag. Like the colors.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Toxicity concerns
customer_reviews.text: A friend advised that this company's products are made in China and they carry no certifications. I'm exchanging for a set that is constructed of safe materials and certified as non-toxic
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Every kid has to have colorful building blocks
customer_reviews.text: These aren’t as easy to come by anymore now that Toys R Us has closed. I wasn’t able to find a big box colored blocks anywhere. Amazon prime to the rescue. I purchased for my nephews first birthday and had shipped directly to him. He loves to build with the colorful blocks. He is learning his colors while he plays.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: FAVE
customer_reviews.text: My nieces and nephew literally play with these blocks FOREVER, sometimes lol. But it's great for helping them learn, build, and share. It wasn't expensive and they honestly love the blocks so much they don't even care about TV or more expensive gifts, the majority of the time! From building houses to cars to just giving blocks to one another, this is hands down a great toy for kids. One of their favorites, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: LoverofPrime

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for playing with your Little one
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves playing with these blocks. They are made well. Only down side is the box that it comes with to store them falls apart supern easily and the lid doesnt stay shut especially if you try to carry it by the handle. What's the point in a handle if u cant use it. Other than that it is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: 2020Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 2 year old. He played with them but was frustrated he kept knocking them over. My fault as he probably bes to be older. They are smaller than expected though. Im just gonna pack them up and reintroduce when he's older. Same as pictured they're just small
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R.

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had a sudden random interest in stacking things so I got her this set for her birthday! She loves them! They are fine quality for the price! We had have no problems with anything! I was worried about some people saying that the blocks were too small (and them bring cheap), but we had no issues with the size or quality of them!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Laman

customer_reviews.title: Great Blocks
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Such good value for the product. They're very durable although I lost a few to our pup. My son loves them and I love to play with them with him as well. Simple toy but lots of practical learning can take place with them.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Bring on the creativity with solid wood blocks and different shapes.
customer_reviews.text: These blocks are great. The kids start off simple, but then they start to find different ways to use them because they aren't just square blocks. you can make windows for castles, and bridges for the cars, or openings for the spaceship. It allows their creativity to come out. Solid qulaity that makes you feel that you will not only have these for a long time, but can pass them on to another generation.
customer_reviews.author: Nuno Santos

customer_reviews.title: Nice entertaining toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our 3 yr. old grandson. He loves to stack an roll things around. He loves these.
customer_reviews.author: skippy521

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: The shapes that are supposed too match are not evenly matched which makes building lopsided. The pieces are REALLY small for the age group suggested. They looked bigger in the picture. Overall disappointing for a Melissa and Doug product...
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Rene M Zajac

customer_reviews.title: Fun Learning
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and fun wooden building blocks. They are a little smaller than I thought they would be but my kids love them. I like how it comes with many different shapes and colors because we can build so much and do learning activities with them such as building with only one color or each "story" has its own color, etc. Hours of fun learning with these blocks!
customer_reviews.author: Crocker

customer_reviews.title: The 3 year old enjoys them
customer_reviews.text: I saw other reviews and was skeptical. I bought for my 3 year old. He loves them and enjoys telling me the different colors. I have not noticed any splintering, fade or staining from the colors, or any cracks in the blocks. They do feel sort of soft though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't follow age requirements. So some of the blocks were small enough for my one year old to put in her mouth. A little alarming as a parent, so kept some of them out of her area. The blocks she did play with were easy to stack and actually kept her interest. She Loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Johnson III

customer_reviews.title: Great for busy bodies. Keeps them in one spot.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son. He spends hours building "pig castles",(from Angry Birds). He tears them down and begins again. There are so many different ways he builds with these. These were added to existing blocks so he could ,"build bigger castles". These integrated very smoothly with his existing set of blocks. My kid has ADHD and these blocks will keep him still and focused for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Itsdarock

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for young child
customer_reviews.text: Great product for more imaginative play. Lots of blocks come in the set and they've gotten good use so far. If then end up falling apart or anything from use I'll return to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful wooden blocks
customer_reviews.text: I run a sensory Instagram so we do a lot of sensory play and color sorting. These are great for sensory and fine motor activities and great creativity boosters. Because it’s Melissa and Doug you know you’re getting a great product that will last for a long time buy this for your first child you’ll still be using them with your third or fourth.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: The set is a little smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Based on the advertised photo of the castle, I had imagined the blocks to be slightly larger than they are. I guess that's my fault... But I can only assume most customers would have the same perception that I had. Otherwise, the set is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Soper

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves to stack blocks, then swipe it and knock them down. This works well, not to heavy, or bulky, so they don’t hurt one falls on her. Fun and entertaining, plus I think it teaches hand/eye coordination, or something like that.
customer_reviews.author: Addy Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than expected. Great for balancing.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't hold his attention as long as I thought, but doesn't ever want to put them away either. We mostly build balancing towers, sometimes fences for the cows. They are really good quality, nice and smooth, lighter than I expected. Almost too smooth- slippery buggers, they slide off when building structures but may wear down with use.
customer_reviews.author: Rad_Rex

customer_reviews.title: A bit smaller than you expect
customer_reviews.text: These blocks are great. My only issue with them is that they are smaller than I thought they would be. I was anticipating the blocks would be about an inch or two (square) larger than they are, but they're fairly small. A bit of a choking hazard if your toddler isn't quite old enough for them yet. Once I saw how small they are, I tucked them away to give him later on.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Trust worthy toy brand
customer_reviews.text: Melissa&Doug is our family's favorite toy brand. The quality of the blocks set is premium and the colors are vivid. My toddler loves to wash the blocks almost everyday and I am happy to see the colors still stay well.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Warning: be careful
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when playing with the wooden blocks. You might get a splinter. I was playing with my 22mo old and as I was grabbing the green block, I got a tiny splinter stuck in my thumb. I used tape glue and a tweezer to take it out as it went in pretty deep. It's fun to stack blocks but just be careful! Glad it was me and not my almost 2 yr old.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: These are too small for very little ones, chocking hazard
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these blocks for our 2 and 4 year old sons. They are fairly good quality, but very small, this wouldn't be such a problem if the two year old didn't "share" with his baby brother. I had to pry one of these blocks out of the baby's mouth, one of the arched pieces was stuck diagonally in his mouth. Luckily he was fine but we will be putting these away for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Orthomommy

customer_reviews.title: Great blocks set
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set of blocks to supplement some you might already have. We had a small set from Circo, some handmade blocks, and some regular alphabet blocks. We bought these to introduce more interesting shapes. These are very small and could easily be a choking hazard for little ones, so I suggest waiting until at least age 2 or 3 before giving these to little ones. And still be sure to stay nearby just in case. Older kids put stuff in their mouths too, as most parents know! This is a great value for a set of wooden blocks. Our daughter has had hours of play from these and the opportunities for creative play are endless.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Good for little hands
customer_reviews.text: Transaction, delivery and packaging all good; good amount of blocks providing for building mazes and tall pretend buildings, perfect my little 5 years old grandson's hands; color and sizes good except the archers ... feel they need to have a little more arch to them but other than that all fine.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add to the ancient set that my sons used to play with. Now their children play with them, plus these new pieces. You just can’t go wrong with Melissa and Doug products. They will last for several generations of children. I’m proof!
customer_reviews.author: Hobbky

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this
customer_reviews.text: You can’t go wrong when buying these wooden blocks. My granddaughters just love them. I did have to take out the smaller ones so my granddaughter wouldn’t put them in her mouth and it’s no big deal, they love this thanks for the fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Quality, colorful and fun Blocks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one set for my grand daughter at Christmas. She is only 20 months, so a bit young yet, however the quality of the pieces are amazing and the colors are so inviting for her. Soon she will be building and I can see the set as lasting decades. By some mistake I was charged for and sent two sets. It was going to cost so much to return them, that she now has a set at my house and hers.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for my 2 year old nephew!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew absolutely loves these. They're on the smaller side. The biggest block (rectangle) is as long as the palm of my hand horizontally. They are a really nice and sturdy wood. Colors are perfect. They stand, stack, and stay up. Even on carpet. I recommend these! I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hood

customer_reviews.title: Melissa and Doug products are always top-notch.
customer_reviews.text: My kids had a set of blocks when they were young. These are much more durable. My granddaughter is 21/2 and loves to see how high she can build. Makes a great gift and as a former pre-school teacher, Melissa and Doug are great quality and educational toys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool toy
customer_reviews.text: This was great for developing spacial relationship and eye-hand coordination. The only complaint is that the blocks are smaller in size than I believed they would be. Still, the price is good and the blocks are fun to play with so all's good in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Beez

customer_reviews.title: We love our blocks.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set of colorful blocks. They a different shape so there are more possibilities. However my boy is only 15 month so I picked 10 blocks of different shapes and colors and he is playing with them, the rest so far I put away. Every week-10 day will change the colors and forms so he will gets familiar with them. Ut is a process of learning and playing - perfect way for a kid to learn. We are happy.
customer_reviews.author: lilac212

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Building Blocks
customer_reviews.text: My grandson LOVES these blocks. He has two sets and builds towns, forts, homes, castles, etc. Great product at a great price. Grandma is happy with this purchase too as it's fun to see him use his imagination and be so creative!
customer_reviews.author: SST Momma G

customer_reviews.title: Small blocks
customer_reviews.text: Small blocks! Paint is not epoxy coated. I just make sure I play with my toddler and provide supervision so things don't end up chewed! The paint will come off if chewed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic deal on these blocks! My kids love to build things so i bought these due to its relative cheapness and the fact that most would get lost because... Kids right?! they hold up very well. I will be buying another set after these ones get lost!
customer_reviews.author: Angellia

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of blocks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set for my 2 and a half year old grandson. He loves all the shapes, especially the cylinders. The set is sturdy and the colors are bright. He used the blocks in a variety of ways. They are very good for open-ended play.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J. Aharoni

customer_reviews.title: Blocks!
customer_reviews.text: Blocks! Only thing better is if there was a packing diagram for folks like me who want to ensure we have collected them all (with the side effect of putting them away neatly) rather than tumble them in a box.
customer_reviews.author: D. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for destructive toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My toddler won’t settle to anything but takes great delight in destroying anything in her path. My husband and I will sit on the ground with her to build towers and she greatly enjoys systematically knocking them down, it would keep her busy for an hour. We have great hopes in her future career as a demolition expert.
customer_reviews.author: rachel small

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother......too small!
customer_reviews.text: Too small! Lots of blocks but they are so small that little hands can't control them to build with them. Really wish I hadn't purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Tiny blocks
customer_reviews.text: The images are clearly photoshopped to make the blocks look bigger... I ordered it, so that my son could start building things, but the smallest parts are clearly a choking hazard. I am going 5o return this item. Great for older kids, but not for anyone, who likes to put things in their mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Nina G

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for all ages: practice stacking milestone, colors, great for cause & effect & best way to build for sturdier structure
customer_reviews.text: Blocks are awesome! Kids can build and create! They can knock them over and build again. They can figure out the best way to build for a sturdier structure. Younger kids can practice stacking objects! Whether it's two blocks or ten blocks, it can help them meet milestones. Since these blocks are colored, kids can sort by colors! So much can be done with these whether it's play or learning. These blocks are a go to when we are buying birthday gifts for friends' kids. They are useful or all ages!!
customer_reviews.author: Frances Henson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Imagination
customer_reviews.text: Colorful and bright blocks that encourage imaginative play. He’s 2 1/2 now and just starting to actually build little buildings. They are a nice quiet gift, as so many toys are exceptionally LOUD!
customer_reviews.author: ~ Luvs2ShopAlot ~

customer_reviews.title: Wooden blocks are always fun
customer_reviews.text: Wooden blocks are always fun, but when they feel as smooth, and are bright colors like these, they are an all the time fun time. There are enough in this package for big building or a Grammy and grandson to play.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good quality toys
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set for my 3 year old daughter as a Christmas gift. We love the Melissa & Doug toys for the quality and durability. Blocks are colorful, Smooth, and the paint doesn’t normally wear off or chip. She incorporates these blocked with other building toys and action figures.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyK

customer_reviews.title: Eye catching and fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter and 7 months old son enjoy these blocks. They are colorful, eye catching, and easy for small hands to pickup. I am happy with my purchase. Will add a photo tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Aila

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of wooden blocks...
customer_reviews.text: These are well made and sturdy blocks and they frequently get played with by my six year old. We Homeschool, so I ordered these blocks to use in our classroom during break. These are a frequent go to item as he likes to build various structures and then use his cars to race around and through them. They arrived on time and came packaged well. I inspected all of the blocks for chips, splinters etc, before handing them over and I am happy to report that they are all fine. I think these will hold up for years to come. We also like the bright primary colors of the blocks.
customer_reviews.author: T. B

customer_reviews.title: Small pieces
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good set of blocks however your children need to be at an age where they won’t want to place in their mouth. Some of the pieces were surprisingly small for a child under 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Camille D.

customer_reviews.title: My daughter plays with them all day.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this for her birthday and has been playing with it still. They love the cylinder blocks because that is something that doesn't come in other block sets.
customer_reviews.author: M Carolin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful blocks!
customer_reviews.text: As with most products from Melissa & Doug - they are very well made. Bought them for my Grand daughter and they were an instant hit! She is 8 months old, so right now she just loves holding and chewing on them lol But she will grow into them and use them for stacking one day. Beautiful blocks!
customer_reviews.author: D. Auten

customer_reviews.title: Building Blocks with Shapes and Colors.
customer_reviews.text: I bought as a Christmas gift for my nephew who lives in Korea and he has down syndrome. I thought this a great memory sensory toy for color and shapes. His parents where very pleased. I also recommend that they write letters and numbers to use for more educational purposes.
customer_reviews.author: cristi

customer_reviews.title: Nice blocks but a lot smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: These blocks are great quality but they are a lot smaller than I thought they'd be. Like 4 or 5 times smaller than I thought. There are actually a couple pieces we had to remove from the kit because they are a choking hazard for our toddler. Not much weight to the blocks since they're so small, so it makes it harder to stack them.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley E Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: A perfect block set and a great value. The quality of Melissa & Doug products is superb and these blocks were no exception. My nephew loves them and will last long enough for his brother to get use out of them too! The set comes with enough pieces that even if they lose a few there are plenty to go around. Also there is enough that you can divide them up to avoid "fights". The only drawback my brother-in-law isn't happy about stepping on a rouge pointy block :)
customer_reviews.author: GlassSlipper

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love these blocks! They are great quality. We can use them to help my son learn colors and shapes. They are better than just regular blocks. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Best learning tool in the toy box!
customer_reviews.text: Colorful, durable blocks. I bought for a child with cognitive delays and this basic “toy” I call a tool has helped boost her planning and thinking in fun play. The child is 9 but the blocks amused and entertained ages 6-12, so not just for babies! The best part no blue light electronic haze just good old brain power!
customer_reviews.author: Their Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good value but slippery blocks could make for difficult builds
customer_reviews.text: our 5 year old has had these 2 years now and he plays with them with other blocks he has. These are slick, due to the painted surface I suspect and do make it more challenging to stack and build. He builds towers, roads, robots, etc. Very nice to add to a block collection for kiddos imaginations.
customer_reviews.author: SoMoteItBe

customer_reviews.title: Timeless toy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 4 YO boy and a 4 YO girl. Both loved the blocks and immediately sparked their imaginations. Children have been playing with blocks for centuries and it is no different today.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie L Miller

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought these blocks in October and saved them for a Christmas gift for my kids. Bad thinking to plan ahead. Some of the blocks had rough edges and wood splinters coming off them! Horrible and unsafe for my kids. Too bad we didn’t open them until Christmas now I’m stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha C

customer_reviews.title: Tiny blocks
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea they made blocks this small. I was very disappointed in how tiny they are. The kids didnt complain..but they definitely are much smaller than your average block set.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaJean

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my grandson who is two years old. He plays with them everyday. The blocks are made well and are very colorful. They keep him entertained for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug 100-Piece Wood Blocks Set
product_meta.description:
This classic wood block set includes 100 solid-wood blocks painted bright red, blue, yellow, and green. A versatile variety of shapes are included: rectangular prisms, cubes, cylinders, half circles, arches, and two different sizes of rectangular planks and triangles. A set of wooden blocks provides an opportunity for a child to pass the hours constructing towers, castles, towns, and more! Designed for children ages 3 and up, this set offers the opportunity for younger kids to practice their fine motor skills and experiment with the laws of physics while giving older kids an outlet for their creativity. Parents will appreciate the safe, durable construction. Though they're made of solid wood, these blocks are light in weight, which makes them safer for small children. The blocks have rounded edges and a smooth painted finish that won't splinter with play. Our wooden building blocks set is designed for kids entertainment but also introduces early math concepts, and helps children develop good patience and strong motor skills. The Melissa & Doug Wooden Building Blocks Set makes a great gift for kids aged 3 to 8 years. Add the Melissa & Doug Wooden Latches Board to round out the hands-on play experience. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.

AMAZON.COM
Melissa & Doug

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!

See more
feature_bullets: Hours of educational fun: The Melissa & doug wooden building blocks set includes 100 durable wooden blocks in 4 different colors and 9 shapes; it’s a classic educational toy that provides hours of hands on, screen free play and learning

Stimulates creativity: Our set is designed for kids entertainment, but also introduces early math concepts, and helps kids develop strong motor skills and even resilience as they experiment with building, knocking blocks over, and building again

Durable and safe construction: Though our colorful building blocks are made of solid wood, these blocks are light in weight, which makes them safe for kids; the blocks have rounded edges and a smooth painted finish that won't splinter with play

Great gift for ages 3 to 8: The Melissa & Doug Wooden Building Blocks Set makes a great gift for kids ages 3 to 8 years; Add the Melissa & Doug Wooden Latches Board to round out the hands on play experience

The gold standard in childhood play: for more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC news called “the gold standard in early childhood play.”

100 percent happiness guarantee: We design every toy to the highest quality standards, and to nurture minds and hearts; if your child is not inspired, give us a call and we'll make it right; our phone number is on every product

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
